result.execSummary:
The defendant Garrett K. Lindquist was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 6/6/16 - Plea/Sentencing Hearing
Amended Info
$443.00 due in 30 days or 9 days KCJ or 9 days Work Crew.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Cicchini.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Amended misd. information filed.  Deft pleads no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft sentenced to 3 days KCJ.  Credit for 3 days.  Costs ordered.  30 DTP.  In default, 9 days work crew or 9 days KCJ.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.
Email received from attys - case is resolved. (NO DOCUMENT AVAILABLE PER INTEGRITY CHECK  /PT)

ST appears by ADA James Kraus. DE appears with Atty Mike Cicchini and Atty Heather Nelson.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  125 - Atty Cicchini requests the Court not conduct a Ludwig hearing today, as possible resolution is being discussed - granted. Parties are, however, prepared to go to trial. Trial to remain as scheduled, any resolution is to be filed with the court no later than 6/1 @ 5pm. Court takes no action on motions outstanding.
DA office received additional discovery.
Jury selection on June 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Michael Cicchini.  Arguments heard on deft's motion to dismiss.  Court denies the deft's motion to dismiss.  Defense moves for an adjournment - still waiting for add'l discovery.  No objection by the State.  FPT adj to 4/7/16 @ 2pm, JS 4/25/16 @ 9am

Scheduling Order

Defendant, Garrett K. Lindquist, appeared with Attorney Michael D. Cicchini.  Attorney Carli A. McNeill appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Motion to Dismiss has been filed;  arguments heard;  Court denies motion.    ST called witness KPD Det. Pete Deates; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Cicchini. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
